results.title: Laura's pregnant!
results.creator_credit: Deane Hutton, Jean Anne DeVoe and Queen Victoria Hospital Foundation
results.brief_description: Laura’s pregnant! follows 16 year old Laura as she discovers she is pregnant and reflects back on how it all happened, the myths her pregnancy refutes and how she and the baby’s father deal with the situation emotionally and the dilemmas they face. The program briefly explores her options of termination, adoption, marriage and single parenting, without revealing which decision she chooses. A teacher’s guide accompanies the video and provides activities around each section of the tape as well as an extensive bibliography. Suitable for lower and middle secondary school students.

results.title: Late at night
results.creator_credit: Michael C. Chorlton, Bruton Film Studios and Nettlefold Studios
results.brief_description: A London reporter investigates an organised crime ring. Stars Barry Morse; Noel Dryden; Daphne Day; Paul Demel; John Rae; Frank Atkinson; Dennis Harkin; Clifford Cobbe; Ben Williams; Claire Smith; Bill Holland; and Beryl Trent. Story and screenplay by Henry C. James; song ‘Late at Night’ by Arthur Young; musical direction by Arthur Young.

results.title: Last stands: Tasmania
results.creator_credit: Phil Lohrey, David Woodhall and Island Films
results.brief_description: The last stands of temperate rainforests in Tasmania. Examines the issues of the geology of the forest, the problems posed by hydroelectric schemes and logging operations.

results.title: Last call at Maud's
results.creator_credit: Paris Poirer, Karen Kiss and Waterbearer Films
results.brief_description: Nostalgic look at an institution of lesbian culture in San Francisco—the legendary bar Maud’s. Closing in 1989 after more than 30 years of business, the history of Maud’s parallels the the evolution of the lesbian community and the gay rights movement in the United States. Through the reminisces and coming out stories of some of the bar’s long standing patrons, and the use of personal and public archival footage, a largely repressed history of lesbian social life emerges, beginning with the secret world of lesbian bars in the 1940s, through to the frightening vice raids of the 1950s, the colorful gay counter culture of the 1960s and the golden era of gay and lesbian life in San Franscisco in the 1970s and ending with the a reflection on the profound shifts in queer culture that took place in the 1980s. A witty and informative look at the emergence of a distinctly lesbian cultural life with its own unique codes through the eyes of the lesbian women who contributed to its shape.

results.title: Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Vern Barry, Film and Television Communications and United Airlines
results.brief_description: Las Vegas, Nevada, as seen through the eyes of a “go-go” girl. During the daytime various kinds of sports are seen, whilst at night the entertainment city comes to life with activities in casinos, at stage shows and restaurants. No dialogue - music only.

results.title: Land of invention
results.brief_description: Famous Scotsmen who have been responsible for many valuable contributions to the machine age include: Macadam, known for “macadamised” roads; Watt, who developed the steam engine; Murdoch, who developed gas-lighting; Masmyth, designer of the steam hammer; Graham Bell, inventor of the telephone; Telford, engineer responsible for the building of the Caledonian canal; and Simpson, who developed chloroform for use as an anaesthetic.

results.title: Land and live in the jungle
results.creator_credit: United States. Army Air Forces. First Motion Picture Unit
results.brief_description: A training film for WWII servicemen showing basic survival techniques for the jungle. Four crash survivors demonstrate how to survive in the jungle by trapping and fishing, cooking and sheltering from the wet. To reinforce the message, a lone airman shows how to do the wrong things. Van Heflin appears as one of the airmen.

results.title: Lady beware
results.creator_credit: Bruce Kerner, Julian Bercovici and Julian Films
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the four basics of personal safety against criminal attack, showing how to secure oneself, avoid danger, knowing when to flee and engage an attacker. Based on the advice of experts in personal safety. Narrated by Shirley Jones.

results.title: LAcrosse; lacrosse
results.brief_description: A slow-motion exploration of the grace and beauty of the women’s game of lacrosse featuring the United States Women’s Lacrosse Association. The women’s game differs significantly in spirit and in rule from the men’s game in that the women have eliminated boundaries and disallowed body contact.

results.title: La Lutte contre le froid
results.creator_credit: Henri Gruel and Son et Lumiere
results.brief_description: An amusing and well made cartoon, light heartedly pouring scorn on our feeble efforts throughout the centuries to keep warm and resist the hardy since it can be used in so many forms and the widest range of heating systems. Blends animation and live action in an incisive and witty manner which can be enjoyed as much for its vigorous invention as for the precision of its technique.
